snippet: Despite rising controversy over their prominent role, China’s princelings are emerging as a class that has an increasingly important say in ruling the country.
abstract: Hundreds of relatives of China's senior leaders, despite rising controversy over their prominent role in government and business, are emerging as an aristocratic class with an increasingly important say in ruling the country;  rise of so-called princelings will reach capstone when Xi Jinping, son of Communist Party pioneer, is unveiled as China's top leader (Series: Changing of the Guard).

byline.contributor: Edward Wong contributed reporting. Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Despite rising controversy over their prominent role, China’s princelings are emerging as a class that has an increasingly important say in ruling the country.

headline.seo: China’s ‘Princelings’ Wield Sway to Shape Politics
headline.main: Dynasty of Different Order Is Reshaping China
headline.print_headline: Dynasty of Different Order Is Reshaping China
